definition: words with the same phonetic ending/rhyme
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
a scholarly and inquisitive individual (idiom)
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
synonym/close equivalent expression
see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
couple living in destitute misery (idiom)
lit. the scholar buys a donkey (idiom); fig. long-winded verbiage that never gets to the point/idiom mocking scholastic pomposity
lit. the sun setting and the moon rising (idiom)/fig. the passage of time
to make known to every household (idiom); to disseminate widely/to shout from the rooftops
oxymoron
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
